result.execSummary:
The defendant Dominic James Miliacca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs and victim witness surcharges are to be colelcted by DOC frm up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 9/12/20.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
**10/29/2014 credit of 156 days vacated.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey DOC rules.
Random urine and breath tests.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample and pay costs of same unless previously paid.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.  No voting until civil rights are restored.  No possession nor use of any body armor.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs, fees and assessments associated with this count.  25% of prison funds to be applied and any remaining balance to be apid in ful by 9/12/20.  Failure to pay will result in the entry of a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Denying Motion to Vacate DNA Surcharge, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Frederick C. Rosa, Br. 35, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for refund of DNA surcharge
Count one.
Court signed order amending the judgment of conviction to vacate the credit of 156 days that was awarded on count one. Copies sent to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. jbs
Letter from Department of Corrections seeking review of duplicate credit.

Defendant Dominic James Miliacca in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Dominic James Miliacca in custody.  Laura A. Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

AS TO COUNT 1:
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 4 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, credit for 156 days.

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 09-12-20; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge (unless previously paid) to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 09-12-20; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

-Obey DOC Rules

-Random urine and breath tests


AS TO COUNT 2:

Court ordered SENTENCE WITHHELD.  Court placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of FIVE (5) YEARS with the following conditions:

Randum urine and breath tests.

Pay all costs, fees and assessments associated with this count,  25% prison funds to be applied and any remaining balance is to be paid in full by 09-12-20.  Failure to pay will rewult in the enrty of a civil judgement.

Provide DNA Sample and pay the cost of same unless previously paid.

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he/she may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he/she may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Defendant Dominic James Miliacca in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Dominic James Miliacca in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 2::

  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms.No voting until civil rights are restored.  No possession nor use of any body armor.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED pending sentencing.

  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-12-2014 at 08:30 am.

NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO REDUCE BAIL, FILED BY ATTORNEY VALERIA TAYLOR.

Defendant Dominic James Miliacca in court with attorney Valeria L Taylor.  Defendant Dominic James Miliacca in custody.  Thomas Potter for Laura A Crivello appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dominic James Miliacca in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Dominic James Miliacca in custody.  Peter M. Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody. OTP MSDF.
